title: How Countries Work Together After Big Wars
summary: This article talks about how the world changed after World War 2. The United States helped Europe rebuild and keep peace. People in countries like Czechoslovakia wanted freedom from Soviet control. A speaker at a university shared stories about this time. Some students felt safe because of American power, but others from places like Pakistan felt scared because they thought America could do whatever it wanted without consequences. The article explains that the rules for countries to work together are not always fair for everyone. It shows different views on how powerful countries affect others.

background_read: After World War 2, many countries were damaged, and the United States helped Europe get better by giving money and support. This made peace in places like Western Europe. Some countries, like those controlled by the Soviet Union, wanted to be free and join the West. The article shows that not everyone feels the same about big countries like America; some feel protected, while others feel unsafe because the rules aren't always fair for all countries.
